HPI 8089 Toyota Celica GT-Four (ST165) 1991 Rallye Monte Carlo Winner C. Sainz/L. Moya

Manufacturer page: http://www.hpimodelcar.com/line_up/pop/8089/8089.html

5th WRC win for Carlos Sainz
16th WRC win for Toyota (1st Rallye Monte Carlo win)
7th WRC win for Celica GT-Four (ST165)

The model is another fine effort from HPI but it is missing the Marlboro decals.

Even though the second-generation Celica GT-Four (ST185) was being marketed throughout 1991, TTE carried on using the existing 'old' (ST165) type car throughout the 1991 season. By this time it was thoroughly proven and a rally winner in alomst every circumstance.

For Toyota and Carlos Sainz the 1991 season started well, with an unexpected victory in the Rallye Monte Carlo. Such a win was fervently desired of couse - Toyota had never won this event before - but even on the final night Sainz had seemed to be well beaten by Ford debutant François Delecour's Sierra Cosworth 4x4. Until, that is, the Ford suffered a broken suspension joint on the very last special stage, which relegated him to third place at the finish in total despair.

For Toyota a win was a win, gleefully accepted, especially as it had been longing for Monte Carlo success since Ove Andersson himself had begiun driving Toyotas in the 1970s.










Sources:
Rally Giants: Toyota Celica GT-Four by Graham Robson
